name: Albania
description: As everyone recovers from New Year celebrations, the Orthodox community prepares for Christmas. If you can't beat the cold, it's better to embrace it by hitting the snow-covered mountains for white days and cosy nights.

name: Armenia
description: The coldest month. Expect snow and below-freezing temperatures over much of the region. Winter sports get going. Armenians celebrate Christmas, with the devout going on fasts of varying rigour for days or weeks beforehand.

name: Austria
description: One of the coldest months of the year in Austria, this is the right time to hit the peaks for downhill or cross-country skiing, or for snowshoe hikes.

name: Azerbaijan
description: The coldest month. Expect snow and below-freezing temperatures over much of the region.

name: Belgium
description: Days are short, cold and often grey but snow might lay just long enough for an Ardennes ski weekend.

name: Bosnia & Herzegovina
description: As everyone recovers from New Year celebrations, the Orthodox community prepares for Christmas. If you can't beat the cold, it's better to embrace it by hitting the snow-covered mountains for white days and cosy nights.

Croatia
description: As the country goes back to work after the holidays, snow makes inland roads difficult to tackle, while strong winds on the coast and islands limit the ferry schedule.

name: Cyprus
description: Weather-wise January is generally mild, but the Tro√∂dos Mountains can be snow-capped so remember to pack your skis. Tourism is down and some resort-based restaurants and hotels are closed.

name: Czech Republic
description: Days are short - the sun sets around 4.30pm in mid-January - but post-New Year accommodation prices are the cheapest you'll find, ideal for that romantic getaway in a cosy hotel with an open fireplace.

name: Estonia
description: New Year's celebrations and continued festive cheer warm the hearts of locals as they weather the limited daylight of what already feels like an endless winter.

name: Finland
description: It's cold. Very cold and very dark. But this is the beginning of the active winter; there's enough snow for ice hotels, and sledding, snowmobiling and skiing are reliable.

name: France
description: With New Year festivities done and dusted, head to the Alps. Crowds on the slopes thin out once school's back, but January remains busy. On the Mediterranean, mild winters are wonderfully serene in a part of France that's mad busy the rest of the year.

name: Georgia
description: The coldest month. Expect snow and below-freezing temperatures over much of the region. Winter sports get going. Georgians celebrate Christmas, with the devout going on fasts of varying rigour for days or weeks beforehand.

name: Germany
description: Except in the ski resorts, the Germans have the country pretty much to themselves this month. Short and cold days make this a good time to make in-depth explorations of museums and churches.

name: Greece
description: Most islands go into hibernation during winter. However, the capital and surrounding mainland welcome visitors with festivals that aren't really aimed at tourists. Expect local insight and warmth from hospitality (rather than the sun).

name: Hungary
description: Hungary is still festive after the Christmas holidays. It's cold but the skies are bright blue. There may be a light dusting of snow on church spires and possibly ice floes in the Danube and Tisza.

name: Iceland
description: After December's cheer, the festive hangover hits. The first few weeks of the year can feel like an anticlimax - not helped by long dark nights and inclement weather.

name: Italy
description: Following hot on the heels of New Year is Epiphany. In the Alps and Dolomites it's ski season, while in the Mediterranean south winters are mild and crowd-free, although many resort towns are firmly shut.

name: Netherlands
description: The first month of the year is cold and dark but on the bright side, museum queues in major cities are nonexistent and you can thaw out in a cosy cafe.

name: Norway
description: Despite bitterly cold temperatures, January is good for snowmobiling, dog-sledding and seeing the northern lights. By the end of January, the sun has returned to much of mainland Norway.

name: Poland
description: January normally starts with a bang at midnight and a week-long whimper as the country sleeps off its New Year's Eve fun. Don't expect services to be fully restored until after the first week of the year.

name: Portugal
description: A peaceful month to visit, though the weather can be patchy and cool. Dia de Reis (Three Kings' Day) brings the Christmas festivities to a close on 6 January.

name: Romania
description: Expect snow and ice everywhere during, statistically speaking, the country's coldest month. Avoid slushy Bucharest and head instead for the mountains, where ski resorts are in full gear.

name: Serbia
description: As everyone recovers from New Year celebrations, the Orthodox community prepares for Christmas. If you can't beat the cold, it's better to embrace it by hitting the snow-covered mountains for white days and cosy nights.

name: Slovakia

name: Slovenia
description: This is for the most part a quiet month after the holidays, though skiing is generally very good and it's the time of one of the most important sport events in the year.

name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Spain
description: In January, ski resorts in the Pyrenees and the Sierra Nevada are in full swing. Snow in Catalonia is usually better in the second half of January. School holidays run until around 8 January.

name: Sweden
description: This is the peak of winter, with freezing temperatures and snow in most regions. Winter-sports activities draw the crowds.

name: Switzerland
description: The winter cold empties towns of tourists, but in the Alps the ski season is in full swing. Glitzy celebrity station, lost Alpine village - Switzerland has a resort for every mood.

name: Turkey
description: The dead of winter. Even Istanbul's streets are empty of crowds, local and foreign, and snow closes eastern Anatolia's mountain passes and delays buses. Accommodation in tourist areas is mostly closed.

name: Ukraine
description: Winter bites cold in January and you'll have to wrap up pretty snugly to do any sightseeing. However, this is a great time to snap on skis in the Carpathian Mountains.

name: United Kingdom
description: January is midwinter in Britain. Festivals and events to brighten the mood are thin on the ground, but luckily some include fire - lots of it.
